meanings.sent1: The movie was expiring, and the credits started rolling.
meanings.sent2: The lease on the apartment is expiring next month.
meanings.sent3: The battery in my old watch is expiring faster than a speeding turtle.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the day was expiring into a peaceful night.
meanings.sent5: The candle flame flickered, expiring slowly into darkness.

meanings.sent1: The old man was expiring peacefully in his sleep.
meanings.sent2: The patient in the hospital room was expiring, surrounded by loved ones.
meanings.sent3: The balloon, expiring from too much air, popped with a loud bang.
meanings.sent4: The dying campfire was expiring, its embers glowing faintly.
meanings.sent5: The tired runner was expiring, gasping for air at the finish line.

meanings.sent1: The elderly cat was expiring in its favorite sunny spot.
meanings.sent2: The legend of the hero expiring in battle spread throughout the land.
meanings.sent3: The expiring flower wilted gracefully in the vase.
meanings.sent4: The music faded, expiring into silence at the end of the concert.
meanings.sent5: The old book's pages were yellowed, expiring with age.

meanings.sent1: She was expiring her contract with the company after many years.
meanings.sent2: The chef was expiring the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.
meanings.sent3: The student was expiring the exam with a sigh of relief.
meanings.sent4: The artist was expiring the painting with a final brushstroke.
meanings.sent5: The builder was expiring the project, satisfied with the result.

meanings.definition: To reach the end of a period of time
meanings.sent1: The marathon runner was expiring the race after hours of running.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was expiring the school year, looking forward to summer break.
meanings.sent3: The expiring hourglass signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent4: The traveler was expiring their journey, arriving at their destination.
meanings.sent5: The expiring calendar page turned, marking the start of a new month.
